clinical_study.brief_title: Central Mammary Duct Excision; How to Improve the Outcome?
clinical_study.official_title: Central Mammary Duct Excision; How to Improve the Outcome?

brief_summary.textblock: the study compares two surgical techniques in excision of the central duct system of the breast. known also as major duct excision

detailed_description.textblock: first technique used is the original Hadfield techniques. the other technique is Almasad technique published in 1999. in this technique, de-epithelialization of a supraareolar area of nearly 2cm is done and elevation of the nipple areola complex is done to support the retroareolar area.

study_design_info.masking_description: the assessment of the results as regard the complication and long term follow up is done by a person who is blind as regard the study group of the patient examined

primary_outcome.measure: patient satisfaction and sensation of nipple areolar complex complications
primary_outcome.description: cosmetic outcome assessed via score between non-satisfied -extremely satisfied sensation is assessed via acotton bad comaring both side or nearby skin

secondary_outcome.description: eg nipple areolae complex (NAC) sensation, necrosis...etc

arm_group.description: central/mammary duct excision is done by the ordinary method described by Hadfield
same procedure with de-epithelization of the upper pararaeolar area

intervention.description: 2 methods of major/central mammary duct excision are compared as regard the outcome

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
females with nipple discharge / recurrent peri-ductal mastitis
-
Exclusion Criteria:
- suspicion or evidence of malignancy
